Thinking about it. It would be nice to have the option to take up contracts in sandbox to provide different 'challenges' or give inspiration.
You can also edit the persistent file and put in what ever value you want for each, though I would do this with caution as it could make file go bad. Never had it happen but you never know.

Here's how to edit the persistent.sfs in a text editor: search for the text "name = ResearchAndDevelopment" and then look a couple of lines down to the "sci =" line and change that to "sci = 12000" and buy all the nodes as they become available.

(it's the first "sci =" line in the file. The other sci lines refer to results from experiments)

This would be 'career without science' however. If you want actual SANDBOX without contracts, you'll have to find the scenario stanza "name = Funding" and change the "funds =" line too.

Since the very first Science update, I've always ran a second science or career game along side of my main science/career game. I simply config edit the persistence file to give myself ample funds and/or science for what I feel like I'm doing. It is the only way to do science in a "Sandbox" format game. Ridiculous if you ask me. Sometimes when I'm just puttzing around with the game I want to do for instance, a science mission to Duna! But that isn't possible in a standard Sandbox. Performing the experiments just tells you that you don't need to do this... You can't access your science log history, etc.

I really wish they would add these options to the normal Sandbox. Hell, just keep expanding the custom game settings they have implemented for Careers now. That way you can land anywhere in-between Career, Science, or Sandbox that you'd like.
